review: I had high hopes for the Fire TV stick. My prime videos have never worked right via my Roku unit with a full 80% of them not getting sound when selected.  So when I ordered the Fire TV stick i figured that if I was going to be able to watch prime video it would be this way.  Not happening.  Prime video loads and runs correctly as does Netflix. However, the Fire TV Stick has to buffer, and Buffer, and Buffer over and over and over again to the point that it is not enjoyable to watch anything on it.  I do not have anything approaching slow internet service, and Netflix works fine on my Roku and my Apple TV. I just wanted to be able to watch prime videos.  All I got to watch is buffer, buffer buffer.  Maybe Amazon should stick with what they do so very well. Books and packages. Diversity is only good when your product line is functional.  There's no way I'll be giving another donation to experience the fire TV itself.  No (buffer, buffer, buffer buffer) way!
